greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Carlitz-Riordan q-Catalan numbers (recurrence version) for q=-3.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65
Robin Sulzgruber, The Symmetry of the q,t-Catalan Numbers, Thesis, University of Vienna, 2013.
formula: a(n+1) = Sum_{i=0..n} q^i*a(i)*a(n-i) with q=-3 and a(0)=1.
G.f. satisfies: A(x) = 1 / (1 - x*A(-3*x)) = 1/(1-x/(1+3*x/(1-3^2*x/(1+3^3*x/(1-...))))) (continued fraction). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Dec 27 2016
mathematica: m = 13; ContinuedFractionK[If[i == 1, 1, (-1)^(i+1) 3^(i-2) x], 1, {i, 1, m}] + O[x]^m // CoefficientList[#, x]& (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 17 2019 *)
program: (1..n).each{|i| ary << (0..i - 1).inject(0){|s, j| s + q ** j * ary[j] * ary[i - 1 - j]}}
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
ext: Offset changed to 0 by _Seiichi Manyama_, Dec 24 2016
